dcterms:description: The AMI corpus is a meeting conversation corpus used for automatic speech recognition tasks, consisting of recordings from meetings with independent headset microphones.
dcterms:title: AMI corpus

dcterms:description: The Switchboard corpus is a collection of telephone conversations used for training and evaluating speech recognition systems.
dcterms:title: Switchboard corpus

dcterms:description: Fisher English corpus consists of conversational telephone speech data, used for training and evaluating speech recognition systems.
dcterms:title: Fisher English (part 1 and 2)

dcterms:description: NIST SRE 2004-2008 is a series of speaker recognition evaluation datasets used for training and evaluating speaker recognition systems.
dcterms:title: NIST SRE 2004-2008

dcterms:description: The Hub5-00 eval set is a dataset used for evaluating large vocabulary continuous speech recognition systems.
dcterms:title: Hub5-00 eval set
